statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Oregon State 98, Colorado 87
article.story: CORVALLIS, Ore. (AP) -- Chris Stephens had a career-high 27 points and freshman Sasa Cuic added 22 on 7-of-9 shooting as Oregon State beat Colorado 98-87 on Saturday. Marcus Hall had 22 of his 29 points in the first half for Colorado (2-2), single-handedly bringing the Buffalos back from a 16-point deficit. Jason Fontenet had 20 points, including four 3-pointers, for the Beavers (4-2). J.S. Nash added 13 points and four steals. Oregon State shot 64 percent from the field in the first half and 59 percent for the game. Only one Beaver, reserve Derek Potter who was 0-for-2, shot worse than 50 percent. Oregon State led 38-22 after Fontenet made two free throws. That's when Hall took over, scoring the Buffaloes' final 18 points of the first half. The sophomore point guard outscored the Beavers 18-7 during the nearly five minute stretch and cut the score to 45-40 by halftime. The Buffalos came close early in the second half, taking a brief 70-68 lead on Jayson Obazuaye's 3-pointer, but Stephens countered with a 3 and the Beavers went out on a 10-2 run. Hall, who made 12 of his 16 shots, couldn't maintain his first-half production, scoring only seven points in the second half. The Beavers shot 89 percent from the free throw line, with Cuic going 7-of-7 and Fontenet going 6-of-6. Colorado got only four points from its bench. All five starters scored in double-figures, including Obazuaye and Chris Copeland, who each had 15 points. Oregon State junior point guard Lamar Hurd sat out the game with back spasms, ending a stretch of 61 consecutive starts that spanned his entire career. Oregon State's total was its highest since 1997.
